name: The Aurelia Blog
description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - April 2019
posts.description: Today, we're excited to announce the beta of Aurelia's Web Components plugin, enabling you to use your Aurelia custom elements as Web Component standard custom elements, easily inter-operating with other frameworks.

posts.name: How do we React? - Part 3
posts.description: This is part 3 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I conclude our discussion of how Aurelia handles common React scenarios.

posts.name: How do we React? - Part 2
posts.description: This is part 2 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I discuss how Aurelia handles common React scenarios. In this post, we'll cover Render Props.

posts.name: How do we React?
posts.description: This is part 1 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I discuss how Aurelia handles common React scenarios. In this post, we'll cover HoCs.

posts.name: Case Study: Codeline and Aurelia
posts.description: Today we're please to introduce one of our Aurelia community members, Giray Temel, to share with you about Codeline's choice of and experience with Aurelia. Take it away Giray!

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - Early February 2019
posts.description: We've had a few new releases over the last few weeks. Among them are continued updates to the Aurelia CLI. In fact, we found an issue in the CLI that affected new Webpack projects, so be sure to update your CLI before starting anything new. More details concerning the various releases can be found below.

posts.name: Aurelia Release Notes - Late January 2019
posts.description: 2019 is off to a great start with another set of releases that address bugs and add new features to Aurelia. We're also continuing to enable more plugins for script-file deploy along the way. Of particular note is our recent improvements to the aurelia-ui-virtualization plugin for virtual and infinite scrolling. What? You didn't know there was an official plugin for that? Check out this demo to see what it can do [https://aurelia-ui-virtualization.now.sh/].
